articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Trading Company
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Trading Company
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to the Rason Taehung Trading Company.
					 After being briefed on the company before a huge map showing its panoramic view, he went round a general aquatic products processing factory, a stock-breeding farm, a wine processing factory and other places of the company to acquaint himself in detail with the production of export goods and export.
					
					 He highly appreciated the feats performed by the officials and workers of the company, expressing great satisfaction over the fact that they have minutely organized the work for increasing the production of export goods and stepped up trade, contributing to the prosperity of the country. 
					
					 He was greatly pleased to learn that the company has built a modern stock-breeding farm and a fish culture ground covering hundreds of hectares on the shore to produce large quantities of quality seafood of various kinds including shellfish and highly appreciated the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance displayed by them. 
					
					 After looking round the company, Kim Jong Il advanced important tasks which would serve as guidelines for further developing foreign trade of the country on the spot.
					
					 He said that in order to significantly develop foreign trade it is necessary to rapidly increase the production of exports and tap export sources through a mass movement.
					
					 He underscored the need for the fields of railway and marine transports to take thorough measures for transport in order to satisfactorily ensure the transport of freight for trade in keeping with the rapid increase of exports.
					
					 As it is very important to abide by the principle of the credit-first policy in foreign trade it is necessary to pay deep attention to this matter, he said, adding that to this end it is essential to intensify the drive for strictly observing the export discipline and improve the quality of goods. 
					
					 He pointed out that in order to develop foreign trade it is necessary to correctly work out an export plan and thoroughly implement the policy of unified trade and, at the same time, the party organizations and administrative officials should regularly learn about and grasp how the plans for the production of export goods are fulfilled, unravel knotty problems in time and effectively conduct the organizational and political work to honor the export plans.
					
					  Officials in the field of foreign trade have particularly important duties and roles to perform for rapidly expanding and developing foreign trade as required by the developing reality in which they are getting very close to the gate to a thriving nation, he noted, calling for conducting external activities in a progressive manner to steadily expand foreign markets.
					
					 He expressed expectation and conviction that the employees of the company would display patriotic devotion to bring about a new turn in the production of export goods and foreign trade. 
					
					 While touring Rason City on the same day, he learned about the overall work of the city including city construction and management.
					
					 Calling for building the city well under a long-term plan and paying special attention to the party and administrative work in the city as it has many revolutionary battle sites and revolutionary sites, precious treasures of the WPK, and it is one of the important centers for foreign trade, he specified tasks and ways to do so. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Hong Sok Hyong, chief secretary of the North Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK, Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the C.C., the WPK, and Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek and Pak Nam Gi, department directors of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets US Businessmen Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets US Businessmen Delegation
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with the delegation of U.S. businessmen headed by General Charles Boyd, president and CEO of the Business Executives for National Security (BENS), at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday when it paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: DPRK Contribute to Efforts for UN Millennium Development Target
articles.content:
DPRK Contribute to Efforts for UN Millennium Development Target 
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government will further strengthen the friendly and cooperative relations with the United Nations Industrial Development Organization and all its member nations in the consistent idea of foreign policy--independence, peace and friendship--and make positive contribution to the efforts of international community for hitting the UN millennium development target.
					 The head of the DPRK delegation declared this at the 13th UNIDO General Conference on Dec. 9.
					
					 Referring to the achievements made by the organization in the period under review, he said that the draft plan and budget for 2010-2011, to be adopted at the current conference, has been worked out to ensure the effectiveness and economics for the UNIDO's activities even under the difficult financial conditions by the worldwide financial and economic crisis and, at the same time, orient the technological cooperation programme toward attaining the UN millennium development target.
					
					 He underlined the need for the organization to attach priority to the technical cooperation for developing countries and ensure the effectiveness of cooperation while steadily pushing ahead with its reforms, direct sustained efforts to the activities for solving such important problems as food crisis, climate change and energy through provision of its effective assistance to the developing countries in strengthening their agriculture and industry and trading capabilities and developing renewable energy and boost the South-South cooperation.
					
					 Sure guarantee has been provided at present to ensure durable peace on the Korean Peninsula, he said, adding that this helps the DPRK concentrate all its efforts on building an economic power.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Swiss President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates Swiss President
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a congratulatory message to Doris Leuthard on her election as the President of Switzerland.
					 The message wished the President success in her work for the prosperity of the country and the well-being of its people.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Kazakh President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Kazakh President
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Nursultan Nazarbayev, President of Kazakhstan, on the occasion of its national day.
					Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields, Kim in the message wished the President and the Kazakh people successes in their work for progress and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Need to Boost Sino-DPRK Friendship Underscored
articles.content:
Need to Boost Sino-DPRK Friendship Underscored
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Li Jinhua, vice-chairman of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, met the delegation of the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea in Beijing on Dec. 14.
					 The vice-chairman said that the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship provided by the leaders of the elder generation is growing stronger under the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries.
					
					 It is of weighty importance for socialist construction in the two countries to boost the exchange and cooperation between the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference and the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea, he noted.
					
					He expressed belief that the fraternal Korean people under the leadership of General SecretaryKim Jong Il would open the gate to a thriving nation in 2012, the centenary of birth of President 
						Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Cuban Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Cuban Ambassador Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Jose Manuel Galego Montano, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, gave a reception on Tuesday on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of the victory in the Cuban revolution. 
					 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Yong Jin, minister of Education who doubles as chairman of the DPRK-Cuba Solidarity Committee, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and others, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 Staff members of the Cuban embassy here were present there. 
					
					 Jose Manuel Galego Montano said in his speech made at the reception that the Cuban people have pushed forward their revolution their own way, not yielding to any pressure.
					
					 The friendly and cooperative relations between Cuba and the DPRK are the special fraternal ties, he said, adding that the relations between the two countries are growing stronger in all fields.
					
					 He sincerely wished the Korean people great success in the future, too, under the leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop said in his speech that since the victory of the revolution, the Cuban people have defended the sovereignty of the country and made great progress in developing economy and increasing the nation's defence capacity under the steersmanship of their leadership.
					
					 The DPRK together with the Cuban comrades will make positive efforts to boost the traditional friendly and cooperative relations in the future, too, he noted.

articles.title: Results of 2008 Census Made Public
articles.content:
Results of 2008 Census Made Public
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- A national conference on 2008 census took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Wednesday.
					 Present there were Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet and chairman of the State Planning Commission, and officials concerned, Jerome Sauvage, U.N. resident coordinator and concurrently resident representative of the UNDP to the DPRK, and other representatives of international organizations and diplomatic envoys of different countries here.
					
					 Ro Tu Chol said at the conference that the successfully concluded census would be helpful to the adoption of the state policy and the social, economic and cultural development of the country.
					
					 Jerome Sauvage made a congratulatory address there.
					
					 Then followed the public presentation of how the 2008 census was conducted and its results.
					
					 According to data available, the population of the DPRK stood at over 24,000,000 as of October 1, 2008.
					
					 Speeches on the results of the 2008 census were made at the conference.

articles.title: "Among the People" Vol. 84 Published
articles.content:
"Among the People" Vol. 84 Published
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- A collection of reminiscences "Among the People" Vol. 84 was brought out by the Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House. 
					 It contains 18 reminiscences telling touching stories that President Kim Il Sung visited factories, farms and other places and made sure that miracles and innovations were brought about and profound loving care was shown by him in those days when he was leading the revolution and construction. 
					
					 Reminiscences "Encouraging Servicepersons to Create New 'Vinalon Speed'" recount story that the President visited the construction site of the February 8 Vinalon Factory at that time, leading the People's Army to make a breakthrough in socialist construction.
					
					 Reminiscences titled "'Our Officials Should Pay Primary Attention to the Supply Service'" and "Paying Primary Attention to Securing Life of Workers" tell about the great benevolence shown by the President for the workers. 
					
					 The book also contains reminiscences telling stories that the President made indefatigable efforts for the development of the nation's agriculture, clarified issues arising in training reserves for doctors and treating sick people one by one and provided with far-sighted wisdom outstanding leadership over the struggle for frustrating the vicious moves of the U.S. imperialists against the DPRK in the UN arena.
					
					 There are also in the book reminiscences dealing with noble sense of revolutionary obligation and warm comradeship of the President who brought up children of bereaved families with profound care to be able officials and helped an ordinary party official in a rural area emerge a pace-setter in the era.

articles.title: New Stamps Issued
articles.content:
New Stamps Issued
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- A new stamp (souvenir sheet) was issued in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea to mark the 50th anniversary of the start of Koreans' repatriation from Japan.
					 The start of their coming back to the DPRK on December 16, Juche 48 (1959) was a historic event which brought about a radical turn in hewing out their destiny. 
					
					 Printed in the sheet, with letters "In commemoration of the 50th anniversary of the start of Koreans' repatriation from Japan" in its upper part, is a picture of President Kim Il Sung being among repatriates.
					
					 Among the newly issued stamps are those portraying the national flag of the DPRK and the torch of the Tower of the Juche Idea.

articles.title: Wind Power Generators Come into Wide Use
articles.content:
Wind Power Generators Come into Wide Use
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Towns and rural communities  in mountainous and coastal areas of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have introduced wind power generators of different capacities to produce electricity for their own use. 
					 Some ri seats and villages in Kim Chaek City, North Hamgyong Province have exploited wind to generate electricity needed for dwelling houses and entertainment.
					
					 Wind power generators have been installed in newly built modern dwellings in the suburbs of the city.
					
					 Each house avails itself of sea wind, with a vane on its roof.
					
					 Many west coastal areas and some cities and counties including Kaesong City and Hyangsan County, North Phyongan Province, too, benefit from such generators.
					
					 The Electricity Research Institute of the State Academy of Sciences has developed wind power generators with a high degree of efficiency.

articles.title: US Urged to Withdraw Its Nuclear Weapons
articles.content:
US Urged to Withdraw Its Nuclear Weapons
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The United States should withdraw its huge nuclear weapons from Western European countries and south Korea, urges Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a signed commentary.
					 The U.S. is so shameful as to claim that the nukes in Western European countries are not related to the NPT as they were deployed before the conclusion of the treaty, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. stockpile of its nukes in those countries is in breach of the spirit of the NPT the keynote of which is the elimination and non-proliferation of nuclear weapons.
					
					 The U.S. deployment of nukes in Western European countries diametrically runs counter to the trend of the present times toward disarmament.
					
					 If the U.S. truly stood for nuclear disarmament, it should have taken steps to withdraw the nuclear weapons from Western Europe and various other regions of the world.
					
					 If the U.S. stops the production of nukes and opts for eliminating them, other nuclear weapons states will head for nuclear disarmament and then, this will decrease the world's nuclear arsenals and, furthermore, defuse the danger of a nuclear war.
					
					 The Korean Peninsula is the region fraught with the greatest nuclear threat and the biggest danger of a nuclear war in the world.
					
					 The rumor about the non-existent "threat" from the DPRK spread by the U.S. bellicose forces is nothing but an artifice to forward-deploy more nukes and other armed forces for aggression in south Korea and its vicinity and ignite a nuclear war against the DPRK all of a sudden.
					
					 The U.S. is fostering nuclear proliferation while applying double standards in dealing with the nuclear issue.
					
					 The U.S. should show the world in practice that its commitment to "building a world without nuclear weapons" is not an empty talk.

articles.title: Japans' Wrong Behavior Blasted
articles.content:
Japans' Wrong Behavior Blasted
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Tanigaki, president of the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan, said recently when meeting with the U.S. ambassador to Japan that the LDP remains unchanged in its view on the Japan-U.S. relations although it has been turned into an opposition party and these relations become the most important part in Japan's diplomacy. And in a press conference he criticized the present Japanese government's policy toward the U.S. over the issue of transfer of the U.S. military base in Futemma of Okinawa, arguing that it is a big concern to heedlessly overturn the Japan-U.S. agreement as the regime changed.
					 Meanwhile, Oshima, secretary general of the LDP, censured the government for having expressed its will not to bring before the extraordinary session of the Diet a bill on the Maritime "Self-Defense Force's" continued refueling in the Indian Ocean. He claimed that the Democratic Party's policy only calls for abandonment without presenting any plan for future and that the LDP is determined to submit any bill if the Democratic Party of Japan is not willing to do so.
					
					 Commenting on such behavior, Minju Joson Wednesday says that it is a ridiculous conduct of the LDP group obsessed with the anachronistic idea of servility to America and ambition for overseas expansion.
					
					 The Japanese public strongly opposes the relocation of the Futemma U.S. military base within Japan and the prolongation of the MSDF's refueling in the Indian Ocean, the signed commentary notes, and says:
					
					 As been already known, the DPJ set it as its election pledges to turn the Japan-U.S. relations, subordinate relationship, into "equal relationship" and, after taking office, declared the stand to readjust the "Japan-U.S. security system." To this end, the present government of Japan adopted it as the primary task of its foreign policy to solve the issues of relocation of the Futemma U.S. military base and the MSDF's refueling in the Indian Ocean that have long been the subject of controversy in Japan.
					
					 This policy toward the U.S. is fully supported by the public circles of Japan, to say nothing of the inhabitants in Okinawa.
					
					 However, the clan of the LDP only persists in the policy of toeing the U.S. line and overseas expansion, turning aside the reality. This is a reckless act of swimming against the trend of the times.
					
					 The LDP clan's policy of servility toward the U.S. is a suicide act as this will put Japan under the further tightened U.S. military control and lead it to self-destruction.

articles.title: 50th Anniversary of Repatriation Marked
articles.content:
50th Anniversary of Repatriation Marked
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Leading newspapers Wednesday editorially mark the 50th anniversary of the repatriation of Koreans in Japan.
					Rodong Sinmun says that the repatriation was a fruition of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il's Juche-oriented idea of the overseas Koreans movement, their wise guidance to it and warm compatriotic love.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					More than 100,000 Koreans in Japan have so far repatriated to the socialist homeland through the repatriation operation started by the peerlessly great men.
					
					 The repatriation of Koreans in Japan showed the world that the DPRK is a genuine homeland of all Koreans and a cradle of their happiness. It also clearly proved the absolute superiority of socialism to capitalism and dealt a heavy blow at the reactionaries at home and abroad who tried hard to prevent Koreans from returning to their homeland.
					
					 Those returnees from Japan, once subject to harsh suppression and maltreatment, are now all out in the drive for building a thriving nation. They should not forget even a moment the loving care and solicitude shown by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il to bring a worthwhile life and happiness to them and uphold the party with labor achievements.
					
					 Minju Joson calls upon the officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and Koreans in Japan to cherish the high pride and confidence of being overseas citizens of the socialist homeland dashing ahead toward a thriving nation, recording epoch-making events true to the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il and more thoroughly embody Kim Il Sung's Juche-based idea of the overseas Koreans movement and thus bring about a new heyday in the movement of Koreans in Japan.

articles.title: All People Called upon to Effect Great Revolutionary Surge
articles.content:
All People Called upon to Effect Great Revolutionary Surge
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The spirit of devotedly defending the leader amounts to a vividest expression of the inexhaustible mental power of the Korean people and a starting point in all their thoughts and practices today when a high-pitched drive is under way for bringing about a great revolutionary surge in the efforts to open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes this in a signed article.
					
					 It says:
					
					 The main factor of success in the revolutionary struggle and construction is the mental power of the popular masses and its hard core is the spirit of devotedly defending the leader. This noble spirit serves as a source of strength with which the Korean people worked miracles and an engine for weathering any trial and difficulty.
					
					 Let us devotedly defend the Party and the leader by winning a victory in the drive for effecting a great revolutionary surge. This is the revolutionary conviction and will enshrined by the Korean people at present.
					
					For the Korean people the on-going advance for effecting the great surge constitutes a struggle for upholding and defending the Party's idea and cause and eternally glorifying them and devotedly preserving the leadership prestige of the headquarters of the revolution and a do-or-die campaign for preserving and adding shine to the exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il in building a rich and powerful country.
					
					 "When the Party is determined, we can do anything!" This is the slogan representing the faith of all the servicepersons and people who consider the authority of the Workers' Party of Korea absolute and a manifestation of their transparent revolutionary outlook on the leader.
					
					 All the people are now creating immortal heroic epics in the on-going drive as they are fully convinced that only victory and glory are in store for them when they remain true to the leadership of the Party and filled with the strong will to unconditionally and devotedly carry out the Party's policies even if their bones may be broken to pieces.

articles.title: US-S. Korea Joint Air War Exercise under Fire
articles.content:
US-S. Korea Joint Air War Exercise under Fire 
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist aggressor forces and the warmongers of the south Korean puppet army kicked off madcap war exercise codenamed Ssangmae targeted against the DPRK on Dec. 16, according to a military source.
					 Massively hurled into this provocative war exercise which will last till Dec. 18 were fighter bombers and assault planes of the 51st combat flying corps of the U.S. Seventh Air Force present in south Korea and the 20th combat flying corps of the puppet air force.
					
					 This saber rattling frequently staged every year including the periods of the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises is an extremely reckless play with fire aimed at mounting a preemptive attack on the DPRK.
					
					 On Dec. 8 the U.S. imperialists and the puppet army hooligans staged a madcap combined aerial assault exercise in areas along the forefront in Kyonggi Province and Kangwon Province of south Korea, inciting a war atmosphere.
					
					 Involved in this war maneuver are nearly 1,000 troops and 28 helicopters of various types including Apaches of the combat flying brigade belonging to the Second Infantry Division of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces present in south Korea and the assault battalion and the flying battalion belonging to the Seventh Mobile Army Corps of the puppet army. This was an exercise staged under the simulated conditions of an actual battle for breaking through the Military Demarcation Line in "contingency" by boosting the "capacity for conducting a coordinated operation" between ground operation units and units for providing air support.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and the puppet bellicose forces frantically conducted espionage against the DPRK by massively mobilizing spy satellites and various types of strategic and reconnaissance planes within the framework of the on-going war exercise.
					
					 All facts prove that the brigandish U.S. imperialists and the warmongers of the puppet army are talking about "dialogue" and "improved relations" with the DPRK but this is nothing but an artifice and they are, in actuality, watching for a chance to seize the DPRK by force of arms.

articles.title: Peruvian Honorary Citizenship Awarded to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Peruvian Honorary Citizenship Awarded to Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was awarded the title of honorary citizen by the Changcay Municipality, Huaral District, Lima Province of Peru.
					 A ceremony of conveying the certificate and medal of honorary citizenship was held at the district office on Dec. 7.
					
					 A resolution on registering Kim Jong Il as an honorary citizen was read out there.
					
					 It said:
					
					 In token of our respect for His Excellency Kim Jong Il, the supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, who has made distinguished contribution to promoting and strengthening the cultural ties between the peoples of Peru and the DPRK, we, on behalf of the Office of Changcay Municipality, decide to highly recognize HE Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army who is consolidating the fraternal bonds between the two peoples. 
					
					 The certificate and medal were handed over to the DPRK ambassador to Peru.
					
					Written in the certificate bearing the national emblem of Peru and the emblem of the office of Changcay Municipality are letters reading: The Office of Changcay Municipality awards the honorary citizenship of the municipality to HE Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people, on the occasion of the 447th anniversary of the municipality which has historically been called "Villa de Ardedo" of Spain.
					
					 Inscribed in the medal are letters reading "Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people" and "The Office of Changcay Municipality, development for social justice, Governor of municipality Juan Alberto Alvarez Andrade."

articles.title: Meeting Held to Mark Anniversary of Repatriation in Japan
articles.content:
Meeting Held to Mark Anniversary of Repatriation in Japan
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- A meeting of Korean residents in Japan was held at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on Dec. 14 to mark the 50th anniversary of repatriation of Koreans from Japan.
					 Present there were Chief Vice-Chairman Ho Jong Man and vice-chairmen of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, officials of Chongryon and compatriots. 
					
					 Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, said in a report that the realization of the repatriation of Koreans from Japan which the world people termed "a great exodus of Koreans from capitalism to socialism" was a precious fruition of the noblest compatriotic love of President Kim Il Sung and a shining embodiment of the idea of the Juche-oriented overseas compatriots' movement.
					
					He recalled that General Secretary Kim Jong Il, who fully inherited the noble compatriotic love and kind-hearted personality of the President, has shown particular care for the living of the returnees to the homeland from Japan.
					
					 He called upon the officials of Chongryon and compatriots to bear deep in mind the benevolence of the President generation after generation and wage a vigorous struggle to bring about a new heyday of the movement of Koreans in Japan as desired by Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting. 
					
					 Meanwhile, a lecture and a photo exhibition for marking the 50th anniversary of the repatriation of Koreans from Japan took place under the sponsorship of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon.

articles.title: Letter from Chongryon Central Standing Committee
articles.content:
Letter from Chongryon Central Standing Committee
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) presented a letter to General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Dec. 14 on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the repatriation of Koreans from Japan.
					 The letter noted that the repatriation of Koreans from Japan marked a historic event which realized the cherished desire of the Koreans in Japan to enjoy true happiness in the homeland which protects and takes care of their destiny after being subjected to a miserable life as colonial slaves of the Japanese imperialists. 
					
					 Recalling that the care of President Kim Il Sung, the sun of the nation, meant the genuine motherland which the Koreans in Japan ardently longed to see for such a long period, the letter referred to the fact that the President formed Chongryon, an organization of overseas compatriots, enabling them to emerge proud overseas citizens of an independent and sovereign state.
					
					 Noting that Kim Jong Il has taken warm care of Korean residents in Japan, regarding them as members of the big family of Kim Il Sung's nation just as the President loved them so much, the letter stressed that thanks to this loving care and leadership Chongryon and Koreans in Japan could exalt their honor of being a model of the world overseas compatriots movement and a forerunner in the patriotic movement generation after generation.
					
					 The letter evinced the determination of Koreans in Japan to make a tangible contribution to the building of a rich and powerful country, reinforce Chongryon as a proud overseas citizens organization of the DPRK and a true patriotic compatriots body and bring about a new heyday in the movement of Koreans in Japan without fail.
					
					 We will make the Japanese authorities definitely lift the unreasonable "sanctions" against the DPRK so that the sailing of ship "Mangyongbong-92" is resumed, resolutely protect the dignity and rights of Koreans in Japan as overseas citizens of the DPRK and train the rising generation to be proud talented Koreans who will carry forward the patriotic tradition, said the letter.

articles.title: DPRK Important Day Observed in Mexico
articles.content:
DPRK Important Day Observed in Mexico
Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea released the 47th issue of its bulletin on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army. Carried in the bulletin was his picture.
					 The bulletin in an article titled "General Kim Jong Il, Iron-Willed Commander" said that the Korean people held him in high esteem as supreme commander of the KPA on Dec. 24, 1991, adding that his personality as the great brilliant commander has been fully demonstrated for about two decades since then.
					
					 The most important feature of the mode of his commandership over the army is his energetic field guidance, the bulletin said, adding that he has paid endless visits to servicepersons despite heavy snowfall, rough sea waves and steep cliffs and went as far as to Panmunjom under the very nose of the enemy to encourage them.
					
					 Noting that his field guidance to the army is permeated with the love for servicepersons, the bulletin recalled that he took deep care of the soldiers' health and military service.
					
					 Praising Kim Jong Il as the brilliant commander endowed with matchless courage and pluck who brings the enemies to their knees without firing a single bullet, the bulletin stressed that the army and the people of the DPRK would always emerge victorious under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Story of Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Hearing the news that children of revolutionary martyrs arrived in Pyongyang, Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese heroine, accompanied President Kim Il Sung to meet them in early August of Juche 36 (1947).
					 That day she unusually got excited, saying that she should meet the bereaved children.
					
					 When a car carrying the President and the heroine reached the place where the children were at play, the girls and boys rushed for the car breaking into cheers "Long Live General Kim Il Sung!"
					
					 At a few steps before the President, however, they stopped, hesitating to further proceed.
					
					 Their poor appearance -- shoulder-bared jackets, hemp trousers worn out at knees and worn-down straw shoes -- kept them from approaching him.
					
					 The heroine, feeling sorry about their tattered clothes, embraced them and said that the general did not mind them wearing rags and that it was not their fault to be poorly clothed and go hungry.
					
					 She then pushed them towards the general.
					
					 Only then the children flung themselves into his arms, bursting into tears.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige compania comercial Taehung de Rason
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige compania comercial Taehung de Rason
 Pyongyang, 17 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno la Compania Comercial Taehung de Rason.
					  Tras escuchar explicaciones ante el panorama de ella, el Dirigente averiguo en detalles el estado de produccion de articulos exportables y de su exportacion recorriendo varios lugares como el taller de procesamiento universal de productos maritimos, el area de cria artificial de peces y la destileria de ron.
					
					  Evaluo altamente los meritos de los funcionarios y los obreros de la compania mostrandose muy satisfecho de que ellos contribuyeran a la prosperidad del pais al dinamizar las actividades comerciales organizando con esmero los trabajos para aumentar la produccion de articulos exportables.
					
					  Aprecio mucho el espiritu revolucionario de ellos de apoyarse en sus propias fuerzas expresando su gran satisfaccion por el acondicionamiento de la moderna area arriba mencionada y por la produccion cuantiosa de diversos productos maritimos finos como mariscos en los criaderos de cientos de hectareas construidos a la orilla del mar.
					
					  Tras recorrer esta compania, el Dirigente presento en el terreno las tareas programaticas que serviran de guia para desarrollar el comercio exterior del pais.
					
					  Indico que para desarrollarlo trascendentalmente, se debe aumentar la produccion de articulos exportables y librar ampliamente como campana de todo el pueblo la busqueda y el uso de las fuentes de exportacion.
					
					  Continuo que para transportar satisfactoriamente las cargas comerciales conforme al crecimiento rapido de la exportacion, es preciso tomar en la rama de transporte ferroviario y maritimo minuciosas medidas correspondientes.
					
					  Senalando que se debe prestar profunda atencion a la observacion del principio de dar prioridad al credito, cuestion muy importante en el comercio exterior, prosiguio que para este fin, es imprescindible respetar estrictamente la disciplina de exportacion y elevar la calidad de las mercancias.
					
					  Para desarrollar el comercio exterior, hay que establecer correctamente el plan de exportacion y cumplir cabalmente la orientacion de la unificacion del comercio, dijo.
					
					Al mismo tiempo, -anadio- las organizaciones del partido y los funcionarios de la administracion deben averiguar y controlar a menudo el estado de cumplimiento del plan de la produccion de articulos exportables, resolver a tiempo los problemas pendientes y organizar sustancialmente la labor organizativo-politica para cumplir el plan de exportacion.
					
					  Son especialmente importantes el deber y papel de los funcionarios de la rama en ampliar y desarrollar rapidamente el comercio exterior conforme a la demanda de la realidad en desarrollo, en que estamos en las inmediaciones de las puertas de la gran potencia prospera, apunto y subrayo que deben ampliar constantemente el mercado exterior al librar con osadia las actividades exteriores.
					
					   Expreso su esperanza y conviccion de que los empleados de la compania produciran un nuevo viraje en la produccion de articulos exportables y las actividades comerciales trabajando con abnegacion patriotica.
					
					  Ese dia, el Dirigente recorrio la ciudad de Rason cerciorandose de sus gestiones generales como la construccion y la administracion de ella.
					
					  Dijo que la ciudad de Rason alberga muchos escenarios de batalla revolucionaria y lugares de interes historico-revolucionario, tesoros preciosos de nuestro partido, y es una de las importantes bases de comercio exterior.
					
					Por lo tanto, hay que acondicionar esta urbe con vistas al futuro y prestar atencion especial a las labores del partido y de administracion de ella, senalo y enseno las tareas y remedios concretos para el particular.
					
					  Le acompanaron en esta ocasion el secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Norte, Hong Sok Hyong, el secretario del CC del PTC, Kim Ki Nam, los jefes de departamento del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek y Pak Nam Gi.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con delegacion de EE.UU.
						
Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 16 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion de los empresarios norteamericanos presidida por Charles Boyd, presidente y CEO (Oficial Ejecutivo en Jefe) de "BENS" (Ejecutores de Negocios por la Seguridad Nacional) que le hizo una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: RPDC contribuira activamente al logro de las metas de la ONU
articles.content:
RPDC contribuira activamente al logro de las metas de la ONU
Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea fortalecera las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con la Organizacion de las Naciones Unidas para el Desarrollo Industrial (ONUDI) y todos los paises miembros de esta organizacion internacional segun el invariable ideal de la politica exterior de la independencia, la paz y la amistad y hara gran aporte a los esfuerzos internacionales por alcanzar las metas del desarrollo de la ONU  para el milenio.
					  Asi senalo el dia 9 el jefe de la delegacion coreana en la 13a reunion de la asamblea general de la ONUDI.
					
					  Se refirio a los exitos logrados por la ONUDI en el periodo de balance y dijo que el proyecto del plan y presupuesto para 2010-2011 que se aprobara en esta asamblea general fue elaborado llevando el plan de cooperacion tecnica hacia el alcance de las metas del desarrollo de la ONU para el milenio y asegurando la eficiencia y el caracter economico de las actividades de la organizacion aun en la dificil situacion financiera causada por la crisis monetaria y economica del mundo. 
					
					  Senalo la necesidad de seguir impulsando la reforma de la organizacion, dar prioridad a la cooperacion tecnica para los paises en vias de desarrollo y hacer para que se asegure la eficiencia de la cooperacion,  la de prestar de continuo las fuerzas a las actividades para solucionar los importantes problemas incluso la crisis de viveres, el cambio climatico y la energia mediante el fortalecimiento de la capacidad de la agricultura, la industria y el comercio exterior de esos paises y el ofrecimiento de la cooperacion eficiente al desarrollo de energia de recuperacion y la de fortalecer la cooperacion Sur-Sur.
					
					  Finalizo que la preparacion de la firme garantia para preservar la paz duradera en la Peninsula Coreana permite a la RPDC concentrar todas las fuerzas en la construccion de la potencia economica.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun demanda a EE.UU. retirar sus armas nucleares
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun demanda a EE.UU. retirar sus armas nucleares
Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El diario Rodong Sinmun publico en su edicion de este miercoles un comentario individual demandando a Estados Unidos retirar sus cuantiosas armas nucleares almacenadas en los paises de Europa Occidental y la Peninsula Coreana.
					  EE.UU. se muestra evasivo diciendo descaradamente que sus artefactos nucleares en los paises de Europa Occidental no estan sujetos al Tratado de No Proliferacion porque fueron emplazados antes de ser firmado este tratado, comienza el comentarista y prosigue:
					
					  El hecho de que EE.UU. mantiene todavia esos artefactos en esa region geografica viola el espiritu del tratado arriba mencionado, cuyo proposito principal es precisamente la cancelacion y la no proliferacion de las armas nucleares, y resulta totalmente contraproducente con la tendencia de la epoca actual hacia el desarme.
					
					  Si EE.UU. estuviera de veras en la posicion de desarme nuclear, ya habria tomado las medidas para retirar sus armas nucleares emplazadas en Europa Occidental y otras regiones del mundo.
					
					  Si el accede a cancelar las armas nucleares dejando de producirlas, imitaran su ejemplo los otros paises provistos de ellas.
					
					  Por consiguiente, se reducira el arsenal nuclear del mundo y, a la larga, se eliminara el peligro de  guerra nuclear.
					
					  En el ambito mundial, la Peninsula Coreana es la zona que sufre la amenaza nuclear mas grave y corre el mayor riesgo de guerra nuclear.
					
					  Sin embargo, los circulos belicistas de EE.UU. difunden el rumor de la inexistente "amenaza" proveniente de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea con la intencion de emplazar mas fuerzas armadas agresoras, incluyendo las armas nucleares, en las zonas avanzadas del Sur de Corea y su contorno y provocar con ellas la guerra nuclear contra la RPDC de manera sorpresiva.
					
					  Ese imperio promueve la proliferacion nuclear practicando la politica de doble rasero en el trato del problema nuclear.
					
					  El debe mostrar al mundo con acciones practicas que no es una palabra huera su promesa de "construir un mundo sin armas nucleares".
